titleStmt.title: V. B. Young et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4476

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Governor Thos E. Bramblet

We the Undersigned Citizens of Bath would respectfully represent that George ^A.^ Bean was at the Septr. term 1861 fined $40.00 for standing a Jack without License. It appear that said Bean had a License issued by the Clerk of the Montgomery County Court, and at the trial of his the indictment said Beans attorney failed or forgot to make defense and show his license which would have kept him for being fined, as he had not violated the law --
This is one of the case which derseves the exercise of remitting power --

p.persName: V. B. Young C. B. C. C

body.p: Geo ^A^ Bean says that the statements of the foregoing petition to his Excellency Gov. Thos. E, Bramblett. are true --
Sworn to before me by G. A. Bean this 21s December 1863,

R, Gudgell notory
Public Bath Co

Bath Cir Ct
George A. Bean
Petition

Remit except fees & costs
T E Bramlette
